intro: Seseli giraldii, commonly known as the Sierra seseli, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and canyons, and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually pale blue to white, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Seseli giraldii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various traditional purposes.
